intro: Testing to ensure shared names do not interfere with proper functioning of zites...

post.body: This is why you don't detect users based on the non-unique `cert_user_id`. I'm posting from a fresh boot zeronet, but with kaffie hub downloaded, and a kaffieID (non-unique names) registered to be the same as the other kaffieID. The two names are identical, so ZeroMe logs in incorrectly. It could've been easily spoofed to *any* ID, including ZeroIDs. This is why you always, always, always use auth_address for detection of users...
